Chemical Actions and Uses/Pharmacologic Actions/Physiological Effects of Drugs/Radiation-Sensitizing Agents/Photosensitizing Agents
Record.Description: Drugs that are pharmacologically inactive but when exposed to ultraviolet radiation or sunlight are converted to their active metabolite to produce a beneficial reaction affecting the diseased tissue. These compounds can be administered topically or systemically and have been used therapeutically to treat psoriasis and various types of neoplasms.
